title: Building with Ninja + Cuda on Windows 10
body_html:
🐛 Bug

I'm trying to build Pytorch (to get LibTorch) on Windows 10. Currently I'm building with Visual Studio, but it's very slow. The documentation suggests using Ninja, however if I set CMAKE_GENERATOR=Ninja I get the error CUDA support not available with 32-bit windows. Did you forget to set Win64 in the generator target.

How do I get Win64 set as the generator target when using Ninja? Or is Ninja + CUDA not possible on Windows 10?

To Reproduce

Follow instructions here: https://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/windows.html , including trying to use Ninja

Using Windows 10 + CUDA 9.0.

## 🐛 Bug

I'm trying to build Pytorch (to get LibTorch) on Windows 10.  Currently I'm building with Visual Studio, but it's very slow.  The documentation suggests using Ninja, however if I `set CMAKE_GENERATOR=Ninja` I get the error `CUDA support not available with 32-bit windows. Did you  forget to set Win64 in the generator target`.

How do I get `Win64` set as the generator target when using Ninja? Or is Ninja + CUDA not possible on Windows 10?

## To Reproduce
Follow instructions here: https://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/windows.html , including trying to use Ninja

Using Windows 10 + CUDA 9.0.
